Pet Sitter ‚Äî Camp Paws

01 Jul 2025 in Career Journey Last modified at: 2025-10-07

A story about my experience as a pet sitter at Camp Paws in Melbourne, caring for animals, learning patience, and discovering how empathy can cross species.

When I started working as a Pet Sitter at Camp Paws in Melbourne, I thought it would be simple. Feed them, walk them, keep them company. But it turned out to be so much more. Each animal had its own personality, routine, and little quirks that made every day feel different from the one before.

Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI 102)

30 May 2024 in Career Journey Last modified at: 2025-10-07

Reflection on completing the Microsoft Certified Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI 102), learning to design, build, and deploy responsible AI applications using Azure Cognitive Services.

In May 2024, I earned the Microsoft Certified Azure AI Engineer Associate credential. The program deepened my understanding of how to design, implement, and manage AI applications that run in production environments on Azure. It connected theoretical knowledge of machine learning with real implementation practices using cloud infrastructure.

Data Scientist ‚Äî Telkom Indonesia

01 Mar 2023 in Career Journey Last modified at: 2025-10-07

A reflective story about my journey as a Data Scientist at Telkom Indonesia, learning teamwork, problem solving, and the art of turning data into meaningful insight.

Working as a Data Scientist at Telkom Indonesia was both exciting and humbling. It was my first time applying machine learning in a large company environment, surrounded by people whose curiosity matched their technical skill. Every day brought a mix of learning, experimentation, and teamwork that reminded me why I fell in love with data in the first place.

01 Jul 2022 in Career Journey Last modified at: 2025-10-07

Reflection on my 2022 student exchange at Kaunas University of Technology, where I studied Informatics and developed projects in game development, artificial intelligence, databases, and user interface design.

From February to June 2022, I joined the Kaunas University of Technology (KTU) in Lithuania as an exchange student under the Faculty of Informatics. It was one of the most enriching experiences of my academic journey, combining creativity, technical challenges, and cultural growth in equal measure.

Best Research Paper Award: ICCSCI 2021

01 Nov 2021 in Career Journey Last modified at: 2025-10-07

Reflection on my Best Research Paper Award at ICCSCI 2021 for the study ‚ÄòImage Pre-Processing Effect on OCR‚Äôs Performance for Image Conversion to Braille Unicode‚Äô, published in Procedia Computer Science (Elsevier) in 2023.

In November 2021, I received the Best Research Paper Award at the International Conference on Computer Science and Computational Intelligence (ICCSCI). The study was titled ‚ÄúImage Pre-Processing Effect on OCR's Performance for Image Conversion to Braille Unicode‚Äù and examined how different pre-processing methods influence the accuracy of Optical Character Recognition in translating printed text into Braille Unicode. The paper was presented orally and later published in Procedia Computer Science (Elsevier) in 2023 after a delay caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

A story about returning to Citra Kasih Grade School as a librarian, rediscovering familiar halls, reconnecting with teachers, and learning patience through laughter and books.

Returning to Citra Kasih Grade School felt like walking through a memory. The same hallways, the same smell of paper and sunlight through the windows greeted me. This time I was not the student rushing to borrow books. I was the librarian who kept them organized and waiting for curious hands.
